sen.j: 川端 家長 （かわばた いえなが、生没年不詳）は、宇喜多氏家臣。
sen.e: Ienaga KAWABATA (the year of birth and death unknown) was a vassal of the Ukita clan.
Ienaga KAWABATA (year of birth and death unknown) was a vassal of the Ukita clan.
His official rank was Tango no kami (the governor of Tango Province).
His official rank was Tango no kami (the governor of Tango Province).

sen.j: 元浦上氏（浦上宗景）家臣であり、主家滅亡後に宇喜多家に仕え、佐良山城・室尾城の守備に就く。
sen.e: He had been a vassal of the Uragami clan (Munekage URAGAMI), and after the downfall of the Uragami clan, he served the Ukita clan and guarded Sarayama Castle and Muroo Castle.
He had been a vassal of the Uragami clan (Munekage URAGAMI), and after the downfall of the Uragami clan, he served the Ukita clan and guarded Sarayama Castle and Muroo Castle.
He had been a vassal of the Uragami clan (Munekage URAGAMI), and after the downfall of the Uragami clan, he served the Ukita clan and guarded Sarayama-jo Castle and Muroo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 天正11年（1583年）、草刈重継との戦に負けて城を離れる。
sen.e: In 1538, he left the castles after defeating the battle with Shigetsugu KUSAKARI.
In 1538, he left the castles after defeat in a battle against Shigetsugu KUSAKARI.
sen.cmt: defeating the > derfeat in awith > against

sen.j: その後、知行1600石・本丸御番衆並びに鉄砲頭を務めたという。
sen.e: It is said that afterwards, he was given the chigyo (enfeoffment) of 1,600 koku and appointed as the guard of Honmaru (the keep of a castle) and the head of the artillery.
It is said that afterwards, he was given a chigyo (enfeoffment) of 1,600 koku, appointed guard of the honmaru (the keep of a castle) and the head of the artillery.
